alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Crawford; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 03 at 11:09PM CDT until August 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and southeast Illinois, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Clark and Cumberland. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain of 1 to 3 inches has fallen over the northwest half of Effingham County Wednesday evening, and additional showers and thunderstorms will continue through tonight. The greatest flood threat will be closer to the I-70 corridor.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Crawford; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland
